awd_titl_txt: Conference: Renormalization and Visualization for packings, billiards and surfaces
awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides partial support for U.S. based participants of the summer school "Renormalization and Visualization for packing, billiards and surfaces", to take place from 10 - 14 July 2023 at the Centre International de Rencontres Mathématiques, in Luminy, France. The goal of this summer school is to develop a diverse generation of researchers who can take this circle of results further, and to extend them to new domains. In particular, by bringing together researchers in multiple fields, the organizers expect to see new and interesting impacts at the intersection of mathematics, computation, and visualization. 

The summer school will be centered on three minicourses, on the theme of renormalization in geometry, number theory, and dynamics respectively. Renormalization involves rescaling dynamical, geometric, or number theoretic phenomenon to observe behaviors at multiple scales, and renormalization ideas have led to striking visual and computational phenomena and uncovered new connections between seemingly disparate areas of mathematics. The circle of ideas being explored in this research school includes problems motivated by physics, for example, the classical Newtonian mechanics of billiards in two and three dimensions, as well as the geometry and number theory of circle packings. The interactions between mathematics, computation, and visualization are expected to produce interesting pieces of open-source software and striking visuals which can be shared amongst the mathematics community for both research and educational purposes. The conference website is https://conferences.cirm-math.fr/2794.html

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This project supported the participation of US-based researchers in the summer research school "Renormalization and Visualization for packing, billiard and surfaces" held at the Centre International de Recontres Mathematiques (CIRM) in Luminy, France, from July 10-14, 2023, as part of the PI's semester as Chaire Jean Morlet at CIRM.

Participation in this school exposed students and early-career researchers to the latest research developments in the study of billiards, circle packings, and ideas of renormalization, and the connections between these areas, which intersect with geometry, number theory, dynamics, and also computation, visualization, and experimentation.

Students and early career researchers also had the opportunity to present and share their research work in these directions, and built connections for future collaborations (between US-based researchers and researchers from all across Europe and the rest of the world) and expanded their research networks.

The lectures in the school prepared researchers for further participation in the events of the themed semester at CIRM, and more generally to deepen their knowledge and skills in these active areas of mathematical research. 

The lecturers at the school (Kate Stange, Carlos Matheus Santos, and Richard Schwartz) are preparing articles based on their lectures which will be part of a volume commemorating the semester, and Stange's lectures were profesionally recorded and available freely via CIRM's YouTube channel.
